hatthi: the shortened form of hatthī (= an elephant).
hatthikumbha: the frontal globe of an elephant.
hatthipākāra: a wall with figures of elephants in relief.
hatthiyāna: an elephant carriage or a riding elephant.
hatthiliṅgasakuṇa: a vulture with a bill like an elephant's trunk.
hanitvā: having killed; having striked; having injured.
hantvā: having killed; having striked; having injured.
hambho: a particle used in addressing equals.
harāpetvā: having made carry or taken away.
harāyati: is ashamed, depressed or vexed; worries.
hare: a particle used in addressing inferiors.
hātabba: fit to be avoided or given up.
hāyitvā: having diminished; having dwindled; having wasted away.
hāyī: one who gives up or leaves behind.
hāra: a string (of pearls, etc.); a necklace.
hiṃsāpetvā: having caused to hurt or injure.
hiṃsitvā: having hurt; having injured; having teased.
hita: benefit; blessing; good; welfare. (adj.), useful; beneficial. (m.), a friend.
himavant: having snow or ice; the Himalaya mountains.
hirikopīna: that which arouses shyness, i.e. the male or female organ.
hīna: diminished; dwindled; wasted away. (adj.), low; inferior; base; despicable.
hīyati: is decreased or dwindled; decays; is left or given up.
hīḷetvā: having scorned; having disdained; having despised.
huraṃ: in the other world; in another existence.
hemantika: belonging to the winter; icy cold.
horāyanta: any device showing the time; a clock.
